title: @Meddler The state of Ahri, Fizz and other mobile assasins.
body:
After the Leblanc and Zed nerf it got me thinking.
Is Ahri and flashy champs like Fizz getting nerf on their mobility soon?
Would be awesome if you guys can reply.

replies.body:
We're putting a bit of power back into Zed and Le Blanc in 5.16, in both cases partial reversions of the previous nerfs, they got hit harder than intended.

5.16 also includes an overall nerf to Ahri's passive (same healing at level 1 and level 16, less healing at the levels in between though).

Fizz we're still talking about. He's a possible candidate for work in 5.17, depends in part on how 5.16 goes though and how the state of the game does or doesn't change.

Quick hide before the rest of the swarm notices your here.

We think that, given her flexibility overall, she shouldn't have as much sustain as she currently does (champs with good pick potential or all in capability often shouldn't have the ability to recover well after a trade).

What about people like Zed? Aside from building lifesteal to recover after a trade, his mobility allows him to just use his shadows to get away. People like Zed have more sustain because they build lifesteal, don't use mana, have a ridiculous amount of escape and then the sheer damage he does.

There's a difference between having sustain available to build and having it built in for free. Especially when you're comparing a melee assassin using what's basically melee-only sustain to a long-ranged mage with AoE spells that have sustain innately attached.

She requires mana to get her passive up, which they already increased on her Q. The mastery changes they made aren't helpful either since her Q at level 1 costs about the same as the teir 1 mana mastery. You don't get mana back as fast as energy or flow. So her sustain isn't as great, if she chooses to all in early in, it costs her most of her mana bar on top of that.

>(champs with good pick potential or all in capability often shouldn't have the ability to recover well after a trade).

I'm honestly curious, why keep the sustain passive if her kit's flexibility makes it imbalanced?

Aside from the trouble of designing/jerry-rigging a new passive, I don't see a drawback with changing/removing her current one. Her sustain coupled with her wave clear, mobility and damage output is what makes her a problem, and you don't sound like you want to tone down the other three factors in her kit.

But just toning down the sustain passive until it's basically invisible means that she has a piece in her kit holding her back balance-wise. That's how it has happened with previous champions, albeit with factors other than sustain.

Maybe I'm missing something, or I'm allowing logic dictate my thoughts entirely on this.

Thanks for the reply. I never really quite looked at it from that perspective, should be interesting to see what it does to her . One last question, have y'all ever entertained they idea of going back in the direction they took her in season 4 where more emphasis was on her charm than her orb? That was my personal favorite iteration of Ahri.

>Fizz we're still talking about. He's a possible candidate for work in 5.17, depends in part on how 5.16 goes though and how the state of the game does or doesn't change.

May I recommend increasing his E CD. It's so bullshit that he can E so often once he has it maxed.

Honestly I believe Ahri's free move speed should be gated. There was a dev discussion earlier explaining how free movement on demand was bad and movement in certain scenarios is desired, like Yasou's minion dash etc. 

Currently Ahri's Q move speed is a "fire and forget" whenever free massive move speed on top of being a great damage/heal. Other champions like Viktor has to have a minion at hand (and spend gold) to boost their move speed.

My suggestion would be to only add a move speed buff if a target is hit, a small move speed buff for single target and more move speed for multiple targets hit. This would lower her dueling potential a bit when her ult is of cool down (or have to hit the minion wave as well as the lane opponent) while still giving her a reward of move speed for good aim in team fights.

Fizz needs to have his E telegraphed better, it's a great movement and invulnerability spell as well as a very high damage spell. The problem is that with his ability to change direction mid air it is almost impossible to avoid the damage. The landing area should be highlighted as soon as it's chosen by the Fizz player (or something like 0,5sec before landing), making it easier to predict and dodge as well as saving potential cc for the landing area.

Other things could potentially be added to this as well for Fizz if he's still oppressive, such as a higher cool down on his E if it doesn't hit a champion (similar to how Gragas belly dash was handled) making it less attractive to use for wave clear and jumping walls, but still rewarding good use in team fights.

From the end of S3 patch 3.13, Ahri's healing was changed from spell vamp to heals 2 + (1 * level) + (9% AP) per enemy hit by the empowered ability.

So in the upcoming 5.16 patch passive healing is being nerfed again... Which is why i personally use flask, because of the original healing nerfs.

Which means her healing at levels [1/6/11/16] which is [3/8/13/18] is being changed to
Essence Theft (Passive) healing changed to [3/5/9/18 at level 1/6/11/16] from [2 + (1x Level)]

So i did some further calculations on her loss of healing if she were to hit 6 enemies(Basically a minion wave).

Just hitting 6 minions for sustain with orb, since she can't W-Q for that spell vamp sustain anymore is adjusted to the following,

* levels [1/6/11/16] - [18/30/54/108] compared to her current healing of
* levels [1/6/11/16] - [18/48/78/108] Which also means she misses out on 120 passive healing lvl 18.


This is not including the 9% AP scaling healing ratio.

If the 9% scaling ap ratio is taken away, 
(I'm doing calculations from a build i tend to run on {{champion:103}} with {{item:3165}} {{item:3089}} {{item:3135}} {{item:3285}}  
at lvl 16 setting)
just with AP from runes and items not including masteries, but including the rabbadans boost. 380 Ap(items) + 25 AP(scaling blues) which is boosted to about ~546 AP at lvl 16.
Which is essentially a ~49 healing bonus at lvl 16. So at lvl 16 she should be obtaining ~157 heal if she hit 6 minions opposed to 108. 
That's also not including the lack of sustain she losses lvl 2-5, 7-10, 12-15,17-18.

Overall a disgusting nerf that's not needed. Her lvl 16 healing is basically a free insant health pot. Early on in the game it's a very small fraction of that.

If Riot does not want Ahri to heal with a passive, then can you rework her passive todo something else then? Rather than jipping her with a now horrible passive that doesn't even have comparable stats to before.

Who cares about Ahris mobility? Would you rather it be replaced with some kind of "murder death" ult? It's meant to position yourself quickly for a Q, and then go back. It's a cohesive kit that synergizes with itself

I think that ap fizz is in a balanced state now, he's one of the champions that I have the most fun playing.  He's only strong if you know what you're doing and he only really face rolls in low elo.  If you know how to play fizz and play around him, he's really not a problem.  The problem is that people don't understand you can't just do the same shit over and over again and expect to win.  Low elo people have a tendency to do the exact same combos at the exact same time, which make them really easy to dodge with fizz.  If I'm playing against a lux and she blows her entire spell rotation off right when I q to her every time, then of course I'm gonna e then and all her damage is void.  Instead of realizing this though, most people will just do the same thing and then cry that fizz is OP instead of looking what they did wrong and thinking about their actions.  If you just wait till he blows his e and use your spells then, then he is fucked.  People never acknowledge that maybe their opponents have skill, its always that the other champ is OP.

Ahri is in a fairly balanced state as well, she's a mid range mage that trades high damage for mobility.  Sure she has three dashes with her ult and movement speed with her q but look at other mid range mages.  For example look at the raw damage from viktor, he absolutely deletes people and the damage on his beam is sickening.   Ahri has nothing like that, she has trouble 100-0 anyone even in the late game.  Unless you're really fed, you can hit a full combo and not even kill an adc without ignite and an ult charge or two.  You don't get that kind of lee way if you get hit from a full combo by viktor or leblanc, you're absolutely deleted.
Perso i only got a prob whit {{champion:105}}. {{champion:103}} is strong but rarely do every thing. {{champion:105}} is low risk high reward.

Its a soft CC that wouldnt really bother non casters that much since they usually can use their escape before Q lands, or go in since he would be in range of their AA or gap closer. It would do its job very well versus casters however without being overbearing.
